lead_paragraph: India successfully hosted its first-ever Grand Prix on Sunday, in front of a 95,000 strong crowd at the Buddh International Circuit outside New Delhi. National dailies were united Monday in their praise for the "flawlessly executed" event (Times of India), which has "dispelled myths" (CNN-IBN) about India's ability to host high-end sporting events after the debacle of the Commonwealth Games. "I honestly cannot wait to come back to India," said the two-time world champion Sebastian Vettel, echoing the sentiments of other Formula One drivers whose time in India has left an "indelible mark" on them (Indian Express). "Good tracks these F1 fellows are used to but friendly, open people proved to be India's greatest ambassadors," according to the Hindustan Times.

headline.main: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Monday
